Description: Landscape with the Flight into Egypt, record of a painting (whereabouts unknown) from the Liber Veritatis; a track passing beneath the ruins of an arch at left and crossing a wooden bridge, beneath which flows a river, two figures in the foreground, one fishing, cattle, sheep or goats nearby Pen and brown ink, brown wash
Curator's comments: See 1957,1214.6 for information on the Liber Veritatis. Kitson, Liber Veritatis: Painting Unknown. Engravings Earlom, 60; Caracciolo, 61.
Bibliographic references: Liber Veritatis 1978 / Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis (60)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: William Cavendish, 2nd Duke of Devonshire
Previous owner/ex-collection: Victor Christian William Cavendish, 9th Duke of Devonshire
Acquisition notes: Accepted by H M Government in lieu of tax on the estate of the 9th Duke of Devonshire. See M. Kitson's 'Claude Lorrain: Liber Veritatis', pp. 28-9, for a full account of the provenance of the sketch-book.
